name: getNetworkClient
description: Return the client associated with the given identifier. Clients can be identified by a client key or either the MAC or IP depending on whether the network uses Track-by-IP.

$ul: **cdp**: The Cisco discover protocol settings for the client
**clientVpnConnections**: VPN connections associated with the client
**description**: Short description of the client
**firstSeen**: Timestamp client was first seen in the network
**id**: The ID of the client
**ip**: The IP address of the client
**ip6**: The IPv6 address of the client
**lastSeen**: Timestamp client was last seen in the network
**lldp**: The link layer discover protocol settings for the client
**mac**: The MAC address of the client
**manufacturer**: Manufacturer of the client
**os**: The operating system of the client
**recentDeviceMac**: The MAC address of the node that the device was last connected to
**smInstalled**: Status of SM for the client
**ssid**: The name of the SSID that the client is connected to
**status**: The connection status of the client
**switchport**: The switch port that the client is connected to
**user**: The username of the user of the client
**vlan**: The name of the VLAN that the client is connected to
**wirelessCapabilities**: Wireless capabilities of the client
